intro: Schoenolirion croceum, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has strap-like, grassy leaves and produces showy, star-shaped blooms that attract pollinators. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant color and ease of care. Schoenolirion croceum is typically grown in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade.
